review: The device is severely limited by Amazon's restrictive & limited app store selection.  The Plex app was smooth, but the video playback was choppy and pixelated.  This device replaced a Roku 3, and it's video was crystal clear.  Sideloading apps and rooting is possible, but it requires complicated steps to boot directly to XMBC.  In the end it's more effort that it is worth, when I can do everything I want with the Roku 3.  Also, wtf, no Spotify app....really?At this point I am planning on returning it.
author: Robert Rowe

review: Can't understand why Amazon has failed to add their own music app into Fire TV ecosystem...I made the purchase in hopes to stream music (forthcoming) and to transfer music library over (allegedly forthcoming)..  Either I have missed how to do this technically, have to wait for some sort of upgrade, or be satisfied status quo.  Come on Amazon be the total package and make the magic happen!Upside: The remote control features are great and entertainment selection is solid.  If your a prime member it is excellent compared to the competition.I'll give the 5th star when one of the two music features I'm looking for is added.
author: Mark

review: I have only had my Fire TV for a short time and I feel I have already totally gotten my money's worth of great viewing.  The picture quality is awesome, there is a ton of free stuff to watch, and the ease of the guide is much better than DirecTV.  I already had Prime, which pays for itself with Kindle book savings and free shipping, so I am receiving all this great programming for nothing!!  I had a question about the set-up  (I'm older and not at all techish) and my question was answered courteously and immediately-Wow.  Huge thumbs up to Amazon for this great product.  Next I'm hooking up an OTA receiver and antenna--goodbye DirecTV--hello money in my pocket!!
author: cheryl martinson

author: Ernst Borchert

review: Got a HDhomerun Prime or Plus?  Want to use the FireTV as a cable box?  Nope.  FireTV does not support MPEG2 hardware decoding, you basically have to turn hardware acceleration off in XBMC 13.2 and switch to software rendering, only to see lots of uneven interlaced frames, making any channel painful to watch.  Raspberry Pi running OpenELEC handles MPEG2 far better, but it has buffering issues on 1080p channels.
